page.title: 08LANGUAGE
page.content: ARE TAEN- GRANDAD'S LAMENT Ay!How things as changed in are taen, No metal tram cars plien up and daun. Runnin wit trollies on metal tract, Chasin Bouton way thaer an alt way back. Ther were a tripe and black pudding shop,A leather shop alus neat but stinking o tan, The sadler a big fat smiling chap never wan, New market as interesting as a weet jamboree. Diminishing is kindness, compassion and care, Wi folk moor concernt wi new fangled ware, Them us sang, lowfed and smiled wi grase, Could plainly be seen on mony a face.
